method.name: Noise Removing Minimal Consistent Set

reference.ref: X.-Z. Wang, B. Wu, Y.-L. He, X.-H. Pei. NRMCS: Noise removing based on the MCS. Proceedings of the 7th International Conference on Machine Learning and Cybernetics (2008) 89-93.
N. Zhang, X.-Z. Wang, T. Xiao. An instance selection algorithm based on contribution. Proceedings of the 7th International Conference on Machine Learning and Cybernetics (2008) 919-923.

generalDescription.type: Preprocess Method. Data Reduction. Instance Selection. Decremental.
generalDescription.objective: Reduce the size of the training set without losing precision or accuracy in order to a posterior classification
generalDescription.howWork: MCS selection is based on the concept of NUNS, the Nearest Unlike Neighbor Subset, which can be looked upon as an optimal descriptor of the inter-class boundaries. The NUN subset is defined as the unique set of all samples which are the nearest unlike neighbors of one or more of the given samples. NRMCS incorporates a noise removing stage within the MCS selection and an error threshold for controlling the importance of the instances inserted in the condensed set.

parameterSpec.param: Distance Function: K-NN implements two distance functions. a) Euclidean with normalized attributed and b) HVDM (see paper D.R. Wilson, T.R. Martinez. Reduction Tecniques For Instance-Based Learning Algorithms. Machine Learning 38:3 (2000) 257-286.)
Error Threshold: Accuracy error allowed for the condensed set.
